001
002package com.commercetools.http.asynchttp;
003
004import java.util.Objects;
005import java.util.Optional;
006import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
007import java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService;
008import java.util.function.Supplier;
009
010import io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpHeaderValues;
011import io.netty.util.AsciiString;
012import io.vrap.rmf.base.client.*;
013
014import org.asynchttpclient.*;
015import org.asynchttpclient.filter.ThrottleRequestFilter;
016
017public class CtAsyncHttpClient extends HttpClientBase implements VrapHttpClient, AutoCloseable {
018    public static final int MAX_REQUESTS = 64;
019
020    private final AsyncHttpClient asyncHttpClient;
021
022    private final Supplier<DefaultAsyncHttpClientConfig.Builder> clientBuilder = CtAsyncHttpClient::createClientBuilder;
023
024    public static DefaultAsyncHttpClientConfig.Builder createClientBuilder() {
025        return new DefaultAsyncHttpClientConfig.Builder().setEnabledProtocols(new String[] { "TLSv1.1", "TLSv1.2" })
026                .setReadTimeout(121000)
027                .setRequestTimeout(121000);
028    }
029
030    /**
031     * Uses a {@link ThrottleRequestFilter} to limit the number of concurrent requests
032     */
033    public CtAsyncHttpClient() {
034        super();
035        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(
036            clientBuilder.get().addRequestFilter(new ThrottleRequestFilter(MAX_REQUESTS)).build());
037    }
038
039    /**
040     * @deprecated usage of maxConnTotal and maxConnPerRoute not advised as there is no pooling done by AHC. Use {@link CtAsyncHttpClient#CtAsyncHttpClient(int)} instead.
041     * @param maxConnPerRoute maximum number of parallel connections to one host
042     * @param maxConnTotal maximum number of parallel connections
043     */
044    @Deprecated
045    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final int maxConnTotal, final int maxConnPerRoute) {
046        super();
047        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(
048            clientBuilder.get().setMaxConnections(maxConnTotal).setMaxConnectionsPerHost(maxConnPerRoute).build());
049    }
050
051    /**
052     * Uses a {@link ThrottleRequestFilter} to limit the number of concurrent requests
053     * @param maxConnections maximum number of parallel connections
054     */
055    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final int maxConnections) {
056        super();
057        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(
058            clientBuilder.get().addRequestFilter(new ThrottleRequestFilter(maxConnections)).build());
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * creates a default instance of the AsyncHttpClient
063     * @param options options to build the underlying HTTP client
064     */
065    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final BuilderOptions options) {
066        super();
067        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(options.plus(clientBuilder.get()).build());
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * @deprecated usage of maxConnTotal and maxConnPerRoute not advised as there is no pooling done by AHC. Use {@link CtAsyncHttpClient#CtAsyncHttpClient(int, BuilderOptions)} instead.
072     * @param maxConnPerRoute maximum number of parallel connections to one host
073     * @param maxConnTotal maximum number of parallel connections
074     * @param options options to build the underlying HTTP client
075     */
076    @Deprecated
077    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final int maxConnTotal, final int maxConnPerRoute, final BuilderOptions options) {
078        super();
079        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(
080            options.plus(clientBuilder.get().setMaxConnections(maxConnTotal).setMaxConnectionsPerHost(maxConnPerRoute))
081                    .build());
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Uses a {@link ThrottleRequestFilter} to limit the number of concurrent requests
086     * @param maxConnections maximum number of parallel connections
087     * @param options options to build the underlying HTTP client
088     */
089    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final int maxConnections, final BuilderOptions options) {
090        super();
091        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(
092            options.plus(clientBuilder.get().addRequestFilter(new ThrottleRequestFilter(maxConnections))).build());
093    }
094
095    /**
096     * creates a instance of the AsyncHttpClient using the provided builder
097     * @param builderSupplier builder with the configuration of the underlying HTTP client
098     */
099    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final Supplier<DefaultAsyncHttpClientConfig.Builder> builderSupplier) {
100        super();
101        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(builderSupplier.get().build());
102    }
103
104    /**
105     * creates a default instance of the AsyncHttpClient
106     * @param executor ExecutorService to be used for the client
107     */
108    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final ExecutorService executor) {
109        super(executor);
110        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(clientBuilder.get().build());
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * @deprecated usage of maxConnTotal and maxConnPerRoute not advised as there is no pooling done by AHC. Use {@link CtAsyncHttpClient#CtAsyncHttpClient(ExecutorService, int)} instead.
115     * @param maxConnPerRoute maximum number of parallel connections to one host
116     * @param maxConnTotal maximum number of parallel connections
117     * @param executor ExecutorService to be used
118     */
119    @Deprecated
120    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final ExecutorService executor, final int maxConnTotal, final int maxConnPerRoute) {
121        super(executor);
122        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(
123            clientBuilder.get().setMaxConnections(maxConnTotal).setMaxConnectionsPerHost(maxConnPerRoute).build());
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * Uses a {@link ThrottleRequestFilter} to limit the number of concurrent requests
128     * @param maxConnections maximum number of parallel connections
129     * @param executor ExecutorService to be used
130     */
131    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final ExecutorService executor, final int maxConnections) {
132        super(executor);
133        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(
134            clientBuilder.get().addRequestFilter(new ThrottleRequestFilter(maxConnections)).build());
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * creates a default instance of the AsyncHttpClient
139     * @param executor ExecutorService to be used for the client
140     * @param options options to build the underlying HTTP client
141     */
142    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final ExecutorService executor, final BuilderOptions options) {
143        super(executor);
144        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(options.plus(clientBuilder.get()).build());
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * @deprecated usage of maxConnTotal and maxConnPerRoute not advised as there is no pooling done by AHC. Use {@link CtAsyncHttpClient#CtAsyncHttpClient(ExecutorService, int, BuilderOptions)} instead.
149     * @param maxConnPerRoute maximum number of parallel connections to one host
150     * @param maxConnTotal maximum number of parallel connections
151     * @param executor ExecutorService to be used
152     * @param options options to build the underlying HTTP client
153     */
154    @Deprecated
155    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final ExecutorService executor, final int maxConnTotal, final int maxConnPerRoute,
156            final BuilderOptions options) {
157        super(executor);
158        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(
159            options.plus(clientBuilder.get().setMaxConnections(maxConnTotal).setMaxConnectionsPerHost(maxConnPerRoute))
160                    .build());
161    }
162
163    /**
164     * Uses a {@link ThrottleRequestFilter} to limit the number of concurrent requests
165     * @param maxConnections maximum number of parallel connections
166     * @param executor ExecutorService to be used
167     * @param options options to build the underlying HTTP client
168     */
169    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final ExecutorService executor, final int maxConnections, final BuilderOptions options) {
170        super(executor);
171        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(
172            options.plus(clientBuilder.get().addRequestFilter(new ThrottleRequestFilter(maxConnections))).build());
173    }
174
175    /**
176     * creates a instance of the AsyncHttpClient using the provided builder
177     * @param executor ExecutorService to be used
178     * @param builderSupplier builder with the configuration of the underlying HTTP client
179     */
180    public CtAsyncHttpClient(final ExecutorService executor,
181            final Supplier<DefaultAsyncHttpClientConfig.Builder> builderSupplier) {
182        super(executor);
183        asyncHttpClient = new DefaultAsyncHttpClient(builderSupplier.get().build());
184    }
185
186    /**
187     * executes a request
188     * @param httpRequest request to be executed
189     * @return response future
190     */
191    @Override
192    public CompletableFuture<ApiHttpResponse<byte[]>> execute(final ApiHttpRequest httpRequest) {
193        final Request request = asAhcRequest(httpRequest);
194        final CompletableFuture<Response> future = new CompletableFuture<>();
195        asyncHttpClient.executeRequest(request, new ResponseAsyncCompletionHandler(future));
196        return future.thenApplyAsync(this::convert, executor());
197    }
198
199    private ApiHttpResponse<byte[]> convert(final Response response) {
200        final byte[] responseBodyAsBytes = getResponseBodyAsBytes(response);
201        final int statusCode = response.getStatusCode();
202        final ApiHttpHeaders headers = new ApiHttpHeaders(response.getHeaders().entries());
203        return new ApiHttpResponse<>(statusCode, headers, responseBodyAsBytes, response.getStatusText());
204    }
205
206    private byte[] getResponseBodyAsBytes(final Response response) {
207        return response.getResponseBodyAsBytes();
208    }
209
210    private Request asAhcRequest(final ApiHttpRequest request) {
211        final RequestBuilder builder = new RequestBuilder().setUrl(request.getUrl().toString())
212                .setMethod(request.getMethod().toString());
213
214        request.getHeaders().getHeaders().forEach((entry) -> builder.addHeader(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue()));
215
216        Optional.ofNullable(request.getBody()).ifPresent(body -> {
217            builder.setBody(body);
218            AsciiString mediaType = HttpHeaderValues.APPLICATION_JSON;
219            if (request.getHeaders()
220                    .getHeaders()
221                    .stream()
222                    .anyMatch(s -> s.getKey().equalsIgnoreCase(ApiHttpHeaders.CONTENT_TYPE))) {
223                mediaType = AsciiString
224                        .of(Objects.requireNonNull(request.getHeaders().getFirst(ApiHttpHeaders.CONTENT_TYPE)));
225            }
226            builder.addHeader(ApiHttpHeaders.CONTENT_TYPE, mediaType);
227        });
228        return builder.build();
229    }
230
231    /**
232     * closes the underlying HTTP client
233     * @throws Exception in case of failure closing the client
234     */
235    @Override
236    public void closeDelegate() throws Exception {
237        asyncHttpClient.close();
238    }
239}
